question: Who was the first king of Israel?
explanation1: Saul was anointed as the first king of Israel by the prophet Samuel.
explanation2: David was the second king of Israel, chosen by God after Saul's disobedience.
explanation3: Solomon was the third king of Israel, succeeding his father David.
explanation4: Joshua was a military leader and one of the twelve spies sent by Moses to scout out the land of Canaan.

question: What was the name of the first man created by God according to the Old Testament?
explanation1: David was a king in Israel and a prominent figure in the Bible, but he was not the first man created by God.
explanation2: Adam was the first man created by God, according to the Old Testament. He was placed in the Garden of Eden and given the command to tend to it.
explanation3: Moses was a great leader in Israel who received the Ten Commandments from God, but he was not the first man created by God.
explanation4: Abraham was a faithful servant of God and considered the father of many nations, but he was not the first man created by God.

question: Which Old Testament character killed a lion with his bare hands?
explanation1: David slayed Goliath with a stone and sling.
explanation2: Samson was a man of incredible strength. On one occasion, he killed a lion with his bare hands.
explanation3: Moses led the Israelites out of Egypt and received the Ten Commandments from God.
explanation4: Saul was the first king of Israel, chosen by God but ultimately rejected due to his disobedience.

question: Who was the father of King David?
explanation1: Isaiah was a prophet, not the father of David.
explanation2: Solomon was David's son, not his father.
explanation3: Jesse was the father of David.
explanation4: Samuel was a prophet who anointed David as king, but he was not his father.

question: Who was the wife of Isaac and the mother of Jacob and Esau?
explanation1: Rebecca was the wife of Isaac and the mother of Jacob and Esau.
explanation2: Leah was one of the wives of Jacob and the mother of several of his sons.
explanation3: Sarah was the wife of Abraham and the mother of Isaac.
explanation4: Rachel was one of the wives of Jacob, and the mother of Joseph and Benjamin.

question: Who was the prophet who was swallowed by a great fish?
explanation1: Jonah was commanded by God to go to Nineveh and preach to the people there, but he rebelled and went in the opposite direction. God sent a great fish to swallow him, and Jonah repented and finally preached to Nineveh as God had commanded.
explanation2: Elijah was a prophet who confronted the idolatry of the Israelites and challenged the prophets of the false god Baal.
explanation3: Elisha was a prophet who succeeded Elijah and performed many miracles, including healing the sick and raising the dead.
explanation4: Isaiah was a prophet who lived in the southern kingdom of Judah. He prophesied about the coming of the Messiah and the eventual salvation of Israel.

question: Which Old Testament character killed an Egyptian and had to flee to Midian?
explanation1: Moses was born in Egypt and was adopted by Pharaoh's daughter. When he saw an Egyptian beating a Hebrew, he killed the Egyptian and had to flee to Midian to escape punishment.
explanation2: David was a king of Israel who is known for slaying Goliath and establishing Jerusalem as the capital city.
explanation3: Solomon was a king of Israel who was known for his wisdom and wealth. He built the First Temple in Jerusalem.
explanation4: Joseph was a son of Jacob who was sold into slavery by his brothers. He became a powerful ruler in Egypt and saved his family from famine.

question: Who betrayed Jesus with a kiss in the Garden of Gethsemane?
explanation1: Matthew is one of Jesus' disciples.
explanation2: Mark is one of Jesus' disciples.
explanation3: Luke is one of Jesus' disciples.
explanation4: Judas betrayed Jesus with a kiss, leading to his arrest and eventual crucifixion.

question: Who was the disciple that betrayed Jesus Christ?
explanation1: John was one of the twelve apostles of Jesus, but he was not the one who betrayed Jesus.
explanation2: James was also one of the twelve apostles of Jesus, but he was not the one who betrayed Jesus either.
explanation3: Judas Iscariot was one of the twelve apostles of Jesus and he betrayed Jesus by identifying him to the soldiers with a kiss.
explanation4: Paul, also known as Saul, was not one of the twelve apostles of Jesus and he did not betray Jesus.

question: Who betrayed Jesus Christ and handed him over to the Roman authorities?
explanation1: Peter was one of the twelve apostles of Jesus Christ, but he never betrayed him.
explanation2: Judas Iscariot was one of the twelve apostles of Jesus Christ, but he betrayed him to the Roman authorities for thirty pieces of silver.
explanation3: John was one of the twelve apostles of Jesus Christ, but he never betrayed him.
explanation4: Andrew was one of the twelve apostles of Jesus Christ, but he never betrayed him.

question: Who was the apostle that betrayed Jesus Christ?
explanation1: Andrew was one of the twelve apostles, but he did not betray Jesus.
explanation2: Judas Iscariot was one of Jesus' twelve apostles who famously betrayed him to the authorities for thirty pieces of silver.
explanation3: James was one of the twelve apostles, but he did not betray Jesus.
explanation4: Matthew was one of the twelve apostles, but he did not betray Jesus.

question: Which New Testament character is known for being a tax collector before becoming an apostle?
explanation1: Matthew, originally known as Levi, was a tax collector before Jesus called him to become a disciple.
explanation2: Luke was a physician and author of the Gospel of Luke and the Book of Acts.
explanation3: Mark was a companion of the apostle Paul and author of the Gospel of Mark.
explanation4: John was a disciple of Jesus and author of the Gospel of John, as well as several letters.
